Docs.summary: Return a color-int from alpha, red, green, blue components.

remarks.para: Return a color-int from alpha, red, green, blue components. These component values should be \([0..255]\), but there is no range check performed, so if they are out of range, the returned color is undefined.

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.argb(int, int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the blue component in the range defined by this color's color space (see ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int)).

remarks.para: Returns the value of the blue component in the range defined by this color's color space (see ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int)).
If this color's color model is not ColorSpace.Model#RGB RGB, calling this method is equivalent to getComponent(2).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

3 element array which holds the resulting HSV components.
Docs.summary: Convert the ARGB color to its HSV components.

remarks.para:
Convert the ARGB color to its HSV components.
  • hsv[0] is Hue \([0..360[\)
  • hsv[1] is Saturation \([0...1]\)
  • hsv[2] is Value \([0...1]\)
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The color long to convert
The destination color space
Docs.summary: Converts the specified color long from its color space into the specified destination color space.
Docs.returns: A color long in the destination color space

remarks.para: Converts the specified color long from its color space into the specified destination color space. The resulting color is returned as a color long. See the documentation of this class for a description of the color long format.
When converting several colors in a row, it is recommended to use #convert(long, ColorSpace.Connector) instead to avoid the creation of a ColorSpace.Connector on every invocation.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Usage: Android.Graphics.ColorObject.Convert (r, g, b, a, source, destination)

Docs.param: The red component of the color to convert
The green component of the color to convert
The blue component of the color to convert
The alpha component of the color to convert, in \([0..1]\)
The source color space, cannot be null
The destination color space, cannot be null
Docs.summary: Converts the specified 3 component color from the source color space to the destination color space.
Docs.returns: A color long in the destination color space

remarks.para: Converts the specified 3 component color from the source color space to the destination color space. The resulting color is returned as a color long. See the documentation of this class for a description of the color long format.

When converting multiple colors in a row, it is recommended to use #convert(float, float, float, float, ColorSpace.Connector) instead to avoid the creation of a ColorSpace.Connector on every invocation.
The red, green and blue components must be in the range defined by the specified color space. See ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int).

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.convert(float, float, float, float, android.graphics.ColorSpace, android.graphics.ColorSpace).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig int32 HSVToColor(float32[] hsv) cil managed
static member HSVToColor : single[] -> int

Docs.param: 3 element array which holds the input HSV components.
Docs.summary: Convert HSV components to an ARGB color.

remarks.para:
Convert HSV components to an ARGB color. Alpha set to 0xFF.
  • hsv[0] is Hue \([0..360[\)
  • hsv[1] is Saturation \([0...1]\)
  • hsv[2] is Value \([0...1]\)
If hsv values are out of range, they are pinned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig int32 HSVToColor(int32 alpha, float32[] hsv) cil managed
static member HSVToColor : int * single[] -> int

Docs.param: the alpha component of the returned argb color.
3 element array which holds the input HSV components.
Docs.summary: Convert HSV components to an ARGB color.

remarks.para:
Convert HSV components to an ARGB color. The alpha component is passed through unchanged.
  • hsv[0] is Hue \([0..360[\)
  • hsv[1] is Saturation \([0...1]\)
  • hsv[2] is Value \([0...1]\)
If hsv values are out of range, they are pinned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

The red component of the color to create
The green component of the color to create
The blue component of the color to create
The alpha component of the color to create, in \([0..1]\)
Docs.summary: Packs the 3 component color defined by the specified red, green, blue and alpha component values into a color long in the specified color space.

remarks.para: Packs the 3 component color defined by the specified red, green, blue and alpha component values into a color long in the specified color space. See the documentation of this class for a description of the color long format.
The red, green and blue components must be in the range defined by the specified color space. See ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int).

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.pack(float, float, float, float, android.graphics.ColorSpace).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function ParseColor (colorString As String) As Integer
public: static int ParseColor(System::String ^ colorString);
public static int ParseColor (string? colorString);
.method public static hidebysig int32 ParseColor(string colorString) cil managed
static member ParseColor : string -> int

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Parse the color string, and return the corresponding color-int.

remarks.para:
Parse the color string, and return the corresponding color-int. If the string cannot be parsed, throws an IllegalArgumentException exception. Supported formats are:

  • #RRGGBB
  • #AARRGGBB

The following names are also accepted: red, blue, green, black, white, gray, cyan, magenta, yellow, lightgray, darkgray, grey, lightgrey, darkgrey, aqua, fuchsia, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, silver, and teal.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the red component in the range defined by this color's color space (see ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int)).

remarks.para: Returns the value of the red component in the range defined by this color's color space (see ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int)).
If this color's color model is not ColorSpace.Model#RGB RGB, calling this method is equivalent to getComponent(0).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: Red component \([0..255]\) of the color
Green component \([0..255]\) of the color
Blue component \([0..255]\) of the color
Docs.summary: Return a color-int from red, green, blue components.

remarks.para: Return a color-int from red, green, blue components. The alpha component is implicitly 255 (fully opaque). These component values should be \([0..255]\), but there is no range check performed, so if they are out of range, the returned color is undefined.

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.rgb(int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return a color-int from red, green, blue float components in the range \([0.

remarks.para: Return a color-int from red, green, blue float components in the range \([0..1]\). The alpha component is implicitly 1.0 (fully opaque). If the components are out of range, the returned color is undefined.

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.rgb(float, float, float).

Docs.param: red component value \([0..255]\)
green component value \([0..255]\)
blue component value \([0..255]\)
3 element array which holds the resulting HSV components.
Docs.summary: Convert RGB components to HSV.

remarks.para:
Convert RGB components to HSV.
  • hsv[0] is Hue \([0..360[\)
  • hsv[1] is Saturation \([0...1]\)
  • hsv[2] is Value \([0...1]\)

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Color.RGBToHSV(int, int, int, float[]).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig class Android.Graphics.ColorObject ValueOf(float32[] components, class Android.Graphics.ColorSpace colorSpace) cil managed
static member ValueOf : single[] * Android.Graphics.ColorSpace -> Android.Graphics.ColorObject

Docs.param: The components of the color to create, with alpha as the last component
The color space of the color to create
Docs.summary: Creates a new Color in the specified color space with the specified component values.

remarks.para: Creates a new Color in the specified color space with the specified component values. The range of the components is defined by ColorSpace#getMinValue(int) and ColorSpace#getMaxValue(int). The values passed to this method must be in the proper range. The alpha component is always in the range \([0..1]\).
The length of the array of components must be at least {@link ColorSpace#getComponentCount()} + 1. The component at index ColorSpace#getComponentCount() is always alpha.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
